intro: Hesperis theophrasti subsp. theophrasti, commonly known as the common honesty, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its white, four-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its fruit is a cylindrical silique that splits open to release the seeds. The species is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its medicinal and ornamental uses.
